pitch black is a sci-fi horror directed
by david tui who also co-wrote the
script along with ken and jim wheat set
500 years in the future it is the story
of a dangerous criminal named richard
riddick who is being transported to
prison on a spacecraft when the ship
crashes on an unexplored planet the
survivors soon discover that said planet
will be entering a state of eclipse
which is bound to bring out some deadly
nocturnal creatures now riddick might be
the one to lead the survivors off this
planet if they can learn to trust him
vin diesel stars in this and additional
cast members include radha mitchell
keith david and cole hauser brotherly
duo ken and jim we had worked on horror
sequels like nightmare on elm street 4
the dream master and the fly 2.
ah
their script for pitch black was
originally called nightfall which was
mostly the same you know spaceship
crashes on an alien planet dark eclipse
brings monsters etc but in the initial
drafts the convict was a woman tui had
done some early work on what would
become alien 3 and he wanted to get this
movie as far away from copycat land as
possible which is why he opted for a
male lead and spent a lot of time
refining the character arcs this film
gained a cult following and spawned two
sequels the chronicles of riddick
released in 2004 and riddick released in
2013. though it became a sleeper hit
many considered the film cliche and
commented on its lack of actual horror

america's shark obsession only seems to

the classic jaws and the discovery

people will watch it and the 1999 sci-fi

that rule the film was directed by renny
harlan whose other action-forward
features include die hard 2 and cliff
hanger set on an island research
facility dr susan mcallister is focused
on harvesting the brain tissue of dna
altered mako sharks as a possible cure
for alzheimer's disease naturally things
soon go awry i mean who would have
imagined that sharks don't make for
docile test subjects these highly
intelligent makos outnumber their human
captors and mcallister and her team must
fight to survive while also preventing
said sharks from escaping to the ocean
and breeding

a knight's tale is an adventure rom-com
written directed and co-produced by
brian hegeland in his breakout role
heath ledger plays the peasant-born
william thatcher who begins a quest to
change his fate and in the process when
the heart of an exceedingly fair maiden
with a little help from his friends
william faces the ultimate test of
medieval gallantry tournament jousting
and discovers that he might just have
the medal to become a legend now this
film isn't so easily categorized on the
one hand it's a period piece on the
other hand it's a rock musical mixed
with historical fiction and splashes of
a sports epic pegaland was calculated in
his genre bending and his time jumping
the writer director admitted that in
1370 when the film is set it really
would have been men in tights but his
premise for this film was no matter what
century you're in the 70s are always the
70s i mean this explains the david bowie
and john lennon references to be of
humble origins
but my personal historians have
discovered
that he is descendant from an ancient
royal line
this is my word
and as such is beyond contestation
production shot on location in prague
and believe it or not the jousting in
this film is real after several failed
attempts to use tricky camera angles and
cgi hegelin decided to have his stunt
people actually joust which adds
authenticity and shock value to the
action sequences but don't worry the
lances were blunted and the actors had
padding though a knight's tale failed to
make it to the land of the fresh it did
gain a cult following and is largely
responsible for making heath ledger the
star that we love and miss so dearly

paranormal activity 2 is a prequel set
two months before the first film in the
franchise we follow the raise a family
who just moved into their new home in
southern california now it's a lovely
place there's just one itsy bitsy little
problem it is haunted as hell after

after the gargantuan success of writer
director orrin pelley's first paranormal
activity paramount wasted no time in
getting a sequel made for this follow-up
kelly took on the role of producer and
todd williams was actually hired to
direct the screenplay written by michael
r perry christopher landon and tom pabst
it is common knowledge that the first
sequel can make or break a franchise so
the pressure was on for this one to be a
hit and commercially i'd say mission
accomplished paranormal activity 2 broke
the record for the biggest midnight
gross for an r rated film and had the
biggest opening of any horror movie in
history it placed number one at the box
office on its opening day and on a
shoestring budget of three million
dollars ended up grossing almost
180 million dollars but the curse of the
house of rey seemed to carry on over to
the critics and many felt that it was
inferior to the first film dr seuss's

nickelodeon's celebrated series rugrats
was adapted into a feature-length film
entitled the rugrats movie released in
1998 the animated comedy finds tommy
pickles trying to return his baby
brother to the hospital after being
warned by his mean-spirited friend
angelica that once his new sibling is
born his parents won't care about him
anymore i mean really angelica you're
saying these awful things to a toddler
while on the mission tommy and his
friends lose their way in the woods and
run into a pack of wild monkeys who have
recently escaped the circus tommy and
his friends begin to think that maybe
things at home weren't so bad after all
the movie features the voices of eg

kath soucy cheryl chase and charlie

plans to make a rugrats feature were in
the works almost as soon as the series
first aired back in the early 90s but
due to production and distribution
obstacles it wasn't until 1995 that
production actually began for this film
it was well worth the wait because the
rugrats movie opened at number one and
became the first non-disney film to
gross over 100 million in the united
states it also spawned two sequels one
released in 2000 and another in 2003 but
as we've learned being popular doesn't
make you fresh and the critical
reception was mediocre roger ebert
disliked the film but admitted that he
might have liked it if he were a kid i'm
confused though was it unclear that
rugrats is in fact a kid's movie

last up is venom let there be carnage a
superhero action film directed by andy
circus and written by kelly marcel it is
the second film in the sony spider-man
universe and the sequel to 2018's venom
we follow eddie brock who is still
struggling to coexist with his
shape-shifting extraterrestrial
counterpart and when deranged serial
killer cletus cassidy also becomes a
host to an alien symbiote known as
carnage brock and venom must put aside
their differences to stop his reign of
terror tom hardy is venom and additional
cast members include michelle williams
naomi harris reed scott steven graham
and woody harrelson and for those of you
unfamiliar with andy circus he is a
master in the art of motion capture
acting he actually portrayed caesar in
the planet of the apes reboot franchise
and played supreme leader snoke in the
star wars sequel film his unique
experience and skill set made him an
obvious choice to direct let there be
carnage as the film relies really
heavily on cgi and motion capture
technology he had also previously
directed the film's breathe and mowgli
the legend of the jungle so this was not
his first rodeo let there be carnage was
a commercial success becoming the
seventh highest grossing film of 2021
but critically it didn't redeem the poor
reception of the first venom film death
